abstract: Why would a company with $145 billion in cash even bother to issue debt? The answer has a lot to do with the frenzied state of the bond markets.
snippet: Why would a company with $145 billion in cash even bother to issue debt? The answer has a lot to do with the frenzied state of the bond markets.

headline.main: To Satisfy Its Investors, Cash-Rich Apple Borrows Money
headline.print_headline: To Satisfy Its Investors, Cash-Rich Apple Borrows Money

byline.original: By Peter Lattman and Peter Eavis
